Argentina: First Jesuit missions to the Guaraní founded in the Upper Paraná area
Belgium:
Death of Joannes Bochius, secretary to the city of Antwerp
Twelve Years' Truce agreed in Antwerp
Burma: Portuguese mercenary Tibao captures Sandwip in East Bengal, northernmost Arakanese territory
Germany: The Catholic League, an alliance of Catholic German princes, was established.
Ireland: Plantation of Ulster by Scottish Presbyterians begins on a large scale.
Philippine: The Dominicans granted permission to open a seminary-college (the present-day University of Santo Tomas in Manila) by Philip III of Spain
Philip III issues a royal cedula requesting from Governor Juan de Silva and the Real Audiencia a report on the projected college (the present-day University of Santo Tomas in Manila).
Russia: Vasili ceded border territory to Sweden in exchange for military aid against the government of False Dmitriy II. Polish–Muscovite War (1609–1618): The Polish king Sigismund III led an army into Russia.
Spain: The Expulsion of the Moriscos was decreed. The Moriscos were descendants of Spain's Muslim population that had converted to Christianity in the early 16th century.
Taiwan: The Tokugawa Shogunate sends feudal lord Arima Harunobu on an exploratory mission to Taiwan.
